arts.ttl: Krystian Bielik has made a brutally honest admission to his Birmingham City teammates
arts.sum: Blues reacted in the right way with a 2-0 win at Exeter and Chris Davies fielded Bielik at right-back for the first time. “The Shrewsbury game was tough for me personally,” Bielik told Blues News before Blues faced Stockport on Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies reveals dressing room message to Birmingham City stars after Barnsley comeback
arts.sum: “I said to the players in the dressing room after the game that that's the kind of victory you will remember for a long time," reflected Davies. Chris Davies believes his Birmingham City players will remember their gutsy victory at Oakwell ‘for a long time’.

arts.ttl: Jay Stansfield double seals Birmingham comeback at Barnsley
Chris Davies opens up on Ethan Laird conversation ahead of tough Birmingham City call
arts.sum: Chris Davies has challenged marauding full-back Ethan Laird to improve his numbers with a place in Birmingham City’s line-up at Barnsley up for grabs. When Laird has played at right-back this season, his position when Blues have the ball has been more akin to a right-winger which arguably makes him the most suitable man to deputise for Anderson.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City braced for Alex Cochrane and Christoph Klarer blows
arts.sum: Keshi Anderson became the first Birmingham City player to reach five yellow cards in League One against Stockport in midweek and misses the trip to Barnsley today. Any player who receives 10 yellow cards before Blues have played 37 games will be banned for two matches.

arts.ttl: Saturday's League One predictions including Barnsley vs. Birmingham City
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's League One fixtures, including Barnsley vs. Birmingham City.

arts.ttl: Five goalscorers to watch out for this weekend: Piroe to strike against Rams
arts.sum: Mo Salah to find the net in the Merseyside derby will be a popular bet this weekend given the Egyptian's scoring streak but Steve Davies has five other potential goalscorers to look out for.

arts.ttl: Our writers disagree on Birmingham City XI as Chris Davies ponders key change
arts.sum: (4-2-3-1): Allsop; Bielik, Klarer, Davies, Cochrane; Iwata, Paik; Laird, Willumsson, Stansfield; May (4-2-3-1): Allsop; Bielik, Klarer, Davies, Cochrane; Paik, Iwata; Harris, Willumsson, Stansfield; May

arts.ttl: Birmingham City set to be without six players for Barnsley clash
arts.sum: Wingers Hansson and Wright have been sidelined for around six weeks now, while Sampsted has missed the last four games with an ankle injury sustained on international duty. Wright suffered an injury in training on the eve of Blues' trip to Lincoln and has now missed six games as a result.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City to cancel loan and make Romelle Donovan transfer decision
arts.sum: Romelle Donovan has returned to Birmingham City early after his loan spell at Burton Albion failed to get going. While Donovan is still eligible to feature for Burton, his loan is expected to be formally cut short in the January transfer window.
